Title: Fourth of July forecast calls for extreme heat for most of US
Description: The Fourth of July holiday is stacking up to be a scorcher for most of the nation, as record-breaking temperatures are expected in the West and South.

Title: 2 police officers wounded, suspect killed in shooting in Waterloo, Iowa
Description: The shooting took place on a major street adjoining Sullivan Park in Waterloo.

Title: North Korea launches a ballistic missile off its east coast, South Korea says
Description: South Korea says North Korea has launched a ballistic missile toward the North’s eastern waters

Title: 4 children, 3 adults wounded in Nebraska home after neighbor opens fire: Police
Description: Seven people were wounded in a Nebraska home Friday after a gunman allegedly opened fire, according to investigators.

Title: French voters propel far-right National Rally to strong lead in 1st-round elections
Description: French voters have propelled the far-right National Rally to a strong lead in first-round legislative elections and plunged the country into political uncertainty

Title: State AG probing police shooting of teen who allegedly wielded replica gun
Description: Three Utica, New York, police officers are under investigation after one shot and killed a 13-year-old boy who allegedly pointed a replica handgun, investigators said.

Title: 11 people injured when escalator malfunctions in Milwaukee ballpark after Brewers lose to Cubs
Description: An escalator malfunctioned at American Family Field in Milwaukee.

Title: Two dead, including an accused shooter, after shots are fired at Virginia gym
Description: Two people are dead after a shooting at a Virginia gym

Title: 'Lab-grown' meat maker hosts Miami tasting party as Florida ban goes into effect
Description: As Florida’s ban on “lab-grown” meat is set to go into effect, one manufacturer hosted a last hurrah with a cultivated meat-tasting party in Miami

Title: 7 killed, dozens wounded after missiles hit town in southern Ukraine, officials say
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russia dropped more than 800 glide bombs in Ukraine in the past week alone and appealed to Western countries to further relax targeting restrictions inside Russia

Title: Should gun store sales get special credit card tracking? States are split
Description: A new national divide is emerging among states over whether to track sales by gun stores

Title: Several US military bases in Europe on heightened state of alert: US officials
Description: Several U.S. military bases across Europe are now operating under a heightened state of alert, ABC News has confirmed.

Title: Hurricane Beryl latest: Where the storm is forecast to hit
Description: Hurricane Beryl picked up power and speed Sunday as it churned in the Caribbean and was upgraded to a major Category 4 storm.

Title: WATCH:  Penguin chicks have 1st swimming lesson at London zoo
Description: Eleven young Humboldt penguin chicks took a dip in the water at London Zoo for their first swimming lesson since they hatched in April.
